chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: The Javadoc plugin provides an intuitive interface for accessing java documentation. The list of available javadoc trees can be populated in the plugin options pane (Plugins > Javadoc > Add/Remove Api Trees..., or Plugins > Plugin Options > Javadoc). Once populated, the documentation can be opened and searched through using the actions provided in the Javadoc plugin menu.

The standard java documentation can be found at www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html (under Additional Resources, look for "Java SE Documentation"). Unzip the downloaded file into a location of choice and add a javadoc tree to "[your directory]/docs/api".
Optionally, you can also add the documentation main directory "[your directory]/docs" to have a shortcut to the documentation overview.
The jEdit api should have come with your jEdit installation. Typically, it can be found in "/usr/share/jEdit/doc/api" or in "C:/Program Files/jEdit/doc/api".
You can browse the documentation, with the action: "View...". This action is only available, if all trees are valid documentation paths, containing a file "index.html".

To quickly search the api trees for a particular class, there are two available actions: "Search...", which opens up a dialog requesting the class name to search for, and the self-explanatory "Search word under cursor". Both require unqualified class names.

This plugin uses the InfoViewer plugin to display the documentation, which can be configured in Plugins > Plugin Options > InfoViewer. Especially, in case of rendering problems, you may choose an external browser, e.g. with commands "firefox $u" or "C:/Program Files/Internet Explorer/iexplore.exe $u".
